article.headline: USC 91, Southern 58
article.story: LOS ANGELES (AP) -- Once USC shed its "Christmas Blues", the Trojans handled short-handed Southern with ease Tuesday night. USC overcame a sluggish opening 10 minutes to beat Southern, 91-58, for its fifth victory in it last six games. Lodrick Stewart scored 20 points to lead five USC players with 10 or more points as the Trojans improved to 5-2 under interim coach Jim Saia. Nick Young added 13 points, Gabe Pruitt and Jeff McMillan had 11 points each and Rory O'Neil and Derrick Craven had 10 apiece for the Trojans (7-4). USC is 4-0 this season when it has five players score in double figures. Chris Alexander led Southern with 19 points and Peter Cipriano added 10 points. Southern (3-6) had only eight players available. Starting center Jerrid Campbell and two others were stranded by snowstorms while attempting to return to the Baton Rouge, La., school after the Christmas break and did not make the trip. USC went on a 12-0 run midway through the first half to break the game open. The Trojans' biggest lead was 77-40 midway through the second half and their final point total was a season high. "I wasn't satisfied with how we started," said Saia, who was named interim coach after Henry Bibby was fired Dec. 6. "It happens when you come back from Hawaii like we did. I like to call it the Christmas Blues." The Trojans won two of three games during their pre-Christmas trip to Hawaii and only practiced once after a three-day holiday break before facing Southern. "It was kind of a long Christmas break," Stewart said. "This was really our first time back on the court. We picked it up on defense, then our offense started clicking." Southern coach Michael Grant said the loss of the three players hurt the Jaguars. "It affected the game a whole lot," he said. "We haven't had a whole team all season and when we had the opportunity to have a whole team, it didn't work out. It was a tough last few days. There was no opportunity to scrimmage. We were throwing coaches in at practice, but they cant play the game." USC begins Pac-10 play Friday at Oregon with its best non-conference record since 2002. "They're learning about me and I'm learning about them," Saia said of his players. "We're establishing an identity. It's a chemistry game and I think were developing some chemistry."

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.
